channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dozens on bins permanently on pavement, 15th January
item.description:
Dozens of waste / recycling bins, permanently living on pavement. There are 38 bins (a collection of waste bins, and various recycling bins) permanently on the pavement in Lansdown Walk - left-hand side heading away from Lansdown Road. A further 6 (sometimes more) are permanently on the right-hand pavement. Some of these bins are always overflowing. There is pieces of litter permanently on the pavement. Looks horrendous - but assume the local residents who use the bins accept it / don't care? Why are so many (any) bins allowed to live permanently on the public pavement? Why is there not provision within the buildings (or at least on private land) for all these bins?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Lansdown Walk, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Demand/extend loops not working, 15th January
item.description:
At 1am every morning with no other traffic in sight I wait at a red light at the junction of Tewkesbury road and Gloucester Road while the lights go through their sequence, wasting fuel etc Why don’t the loops detect me and change to green??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 6 Townsend Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree falling, 15th January
item.description:
Tree is top heavy with Ivy and leaning over the pavement in Blackwater Way opposite Mutsilver Mews.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Blackwater Way, Longlevens

item.title: BT service duct cover, 15th January
item.description:
The duct cover seems to have been run over by a HGV/LGV and has now sunken. It’s not completely obvious, but when walking over it there’s a drop of around 50mm (2” in old money!)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): G B E C House, 31 Barnett Way, Barnwood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Number of Sharp Edged Potholes at Location and along Cleeve Common Road, 15th January
item.description:
The location is the Cleeve Common Road under the line of trees alongside the Bill Smiley Butterfly Reserve and just past upper hill Farm. There are several potholes right in the track a vehicle has to follow and due to the narrow road can be hit from either direction. There are now a number of deep potholes in various places along the Cleeve Common Road. Can these be filled in please as to avoid them, vehicles are eroding the sides of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cleeve Common, Whittington
Report on FixMyStreet
